events.originalText: A nineteen-year-old gunman went on a shooting spree at a shopping mall in Omaha, Nebraska, U.S., killing nine people, including himself.
events.subtitle: Westroads Mall shooting
events.headline: Gunman kills nine in Omaha shopping mall shooting spree

events.originalText: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 56 crashed shortly after takeoff from Nakhchivan Airport, killing 52 people on board.
events.subtitle: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight A-56
events.headline: Azerbaijan Airlines Flight 56 crashes, 52 dead

events.originalText: The Birmingham Americans won the only World Bowl in World Football League history.
events.subtitle: Birmingham Americans
events.headline: Birmingham Americans win only World Bowl in history

events.originalText: Gough Whitlam took office as the 21st Prime Minister of Australia and formed a duumvirate with his deputy Lance Barnard, ending 23 years of Liberal-Country Party government.
events.subtitle: Gough Whitlam
events.headline: Gough Whitlam becomes 21st Prime Minister of Australia

events.originalText: The "glasnost meeting" took place in Moscow, becoming the first demonstration in the Soviet Union after World War II and marking the beginning of the civil rights movement in the country.
events.subtitle: Glasnost meeting
events.headline: First civil rights movement demonstration in Soviet Union

events.originalText: Britain's first motorway, the Preston By-pass, opened to the public.
events.subtitle: Controlled-access highway
events.headline: Britain's first motorway, Preston By-pass, opens

events.originalText: The "Great Smog of London" began and lasted for five days, causing 12,000 deaths and leading to the Clean Air Act 1956.
events.subtitle: Great Smog of London
events.headline: Great Smog of London causes 12,000 deaths

events.originalText: Flight 19, a squadron of five U.S. Navy torpedo bombers, disappeared over the Bermuda Triangle.
events.subtitle: Flight 19
events.headline: Flight 19 disappears over Bermuda Triangle

events.originalText: The remains of Pedro II of Brazil, who was ousted and exiled in a republican coup, were buried after being repatriated.
events.subtitle: Pedro II of Brazil
events.headline: Remains of Pedro II of Brazil buried after repatriation

events.originalText: The 1936 Soviet constitution, also known as the "Stalin constitution", was adopted.
events.subtitle: 1936 Constitution of the Soviet Union
events.headline: 1936 Soviet constitution, 'Stalin constitution', adopted

events.originalText: The prohibition of alcoholic beverages in the United States at the federal level ended when the Twenty-first Amendment to the Constitution was ratified, repealing the Eighteenth Amendment.
events.subtitle: Prohibition in the United States
events.headline: Prohibition in U.S. ends with ratification of Twenty-first Amendment

events.originalText: National Guards and Sokol volunteers protested in Zagreb, leading to an armed clash with regiments of the Home Guard and former Common Army.
events.subtitle: Sokol
events.headline: National Guards clash with Home Guard in Zagreb protest

events.originalText: Amid the First World War and following his loss of support in Parliament, British Prime Minister H. H. Asquith resigned.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: British Prime Minister H. H. Asquith resigns amid First World War

events.originalText: The Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition began in an attempt to make the first land crossing of Antarctica.
events.subtitle: Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition
events.headline: Imperial Trans-Antarctic Expedition begins

events.originalText: Napoleonic Wars: British ships began a raid on Griessie after the Dutch captain refused a British demand for surrender.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: British ships raid Griessie in Napoleonic Wars

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: Continental Army colonel Henry Knox arrived at Fort Ticonderoga in New York to arrange the transport of 60 tons of artillery (depicted) to support the siege of Boston.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Henry Knox arrives at Fort Ticonderoga to transport artillery in American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: Seven Years' War: Prussian troops under Frederick the Great defeated Austrian forces at the Battle of Leuthen (pictured).
events.subtitle: Seven Years' War
events.headline: Frederick the Great defeats Austrian forces at Battle of Leuthen in Seven Years' War

events.originalText: Pope Innocent VIII issued the papal bull Summis desiderantes affectibus, which gave the Dominican inquisitor Heinrich Kramer the explicit authority to prosecute witchcraft in Germany.
events.subtitle: Pope Innocent VIII
events.headline: Pope Innocent VIII authorizes prosecution of witchcraft in Germany
